Authors: Shan Zhong, Jing Zhang, Guozhen Zhang
Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic Characterization of a novel
species of Botrytis causing gray mold on Paris polyphylla in China
Abstract:
Paris polyphylla is an important medicinal plant in China.
A disease similar to gray mold on P. polyphylla occurred at seedling
stage in March 2016 and 2017 in Tengchong city Yunnan Province, China.
Seventeen isolates were obtained from the diseased stems and leaves.
Morphology of those isolates was observed. Mycelia grew at the rate of
10.6 mm/d at 20 C on PDA. Sclerotia were spherical to elliptical
(0.42.5× 0.31.8 mm). Conidia formed on diseased tissue were hyaline to
pale brown, long ovoid and unicellular. Size of conidia was 15.124.5 ×
8.813.4μm. Conidiophores were 5261064×1215μm. Phylogenetic analyses
based on G3PDH, RPB2, and HSP60 sequence data supported a placement of
representative three isolates as a new species in Botrytis. Based on
morphological and phylogenetic characteristics, the causal agent of gray
mold on P. polyphylla was described as Botrytis polyphyllae.
